c:complexType.name: Chart
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of (almost) all charts.

c:property.name: color
c:property.c:documentation:
The first color axis options.
This axis can also be accessed by the property name color.
See for more information on the way that the color axes' properties may be accessed.

c:property.name: legend
c:property.c:documentation:
The legend panel of the root chart.
When a value of type boolean is specified, it indicates the visibility of the legend.

c:property.name: interactive
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if chart interaction is enabled.
Chart interaction is any of the following kinds of interaction: animation, on-hover highlighting, tooltips, selection, clicking and double-clicking.
When false, all kinds of interaction are disabled. The options controlling specific interaction types are ignored: , , , , and .
When true all kinds of interaction may be enabled, that being controlled by its own control option.
When printing, with CGG, is always false, independently of the specified value.
When not printing, the default value of this option is true.

c:property.name: animate
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if a chart should show an entry animation, every time it is fully rendered. Most charts perform some sort of entry animation of its main visual elements.
When a chart is rendered explicitly, through its render method, it is possible to control whether the entry animation is performed or not.
This option is only taken into account when is true.

c:property.name: hoverable
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if the chart's visual elements are automatically highlighted when the user hovers over them with the mouse.
This option is only taken into account when is true.

c:property.name: selectable
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if the chart's visual elements can be selected by the user, by clicking on them or using the rubber-band.
This option is only taken into account when is true.

c:property.name: ctrlSelectMode
c:property.c:documentation:
When true, indicates that a selection made by the user replaces the current selection, if any.
For the selection to be additive, the CTRL key must be pressed, by the end of the operation.
When false, indicates that any selection made by the user is additive. The CTRL key has no effect.

c:property.name: clearSelectionMode
c:property.c:documentation:
Controls if and how the selection can be cleared by the user.
This option applies even if is false. This supports scenarios where a custom selection implementation controls what can get selected, but in which clearing selection is decided by the user, in the default way.
This option is only taken into account when is true.

c:property.name: doubleClickMaxDelay
c:property.c:documentation: The maximum number of milliseconds, between two consecutive clicks, for them to be considered a double-click.

c:property.name: doubleClickAction
c:property.c:documentation: A callback function that is called when the user double-clicks on a visual element.

c:property.name: selectionChangedAction
c:property.c:documentation: A callback function that is called when, after selection has changed, the chart is updated to reflect the change.

c:property.name: userSelectionAction
c:property.c:documentation:
A callback function that is called when the user performs a selection, but before the corresponding datums' selected state is actually changed.
This function is usefull to restrict, amplify, or normalize the selection.

c:property.name: timeSeries
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates that dimensions whose name is "category1", "category2", etc, have a Date value type, by default.
This option has no effect on other dimensions, even if bound to a "category" visual role. In those cases, explicitly define the dimension with the Date value type.
Dimensions are considered continuous, by default, when they have a continuous value type. However, not all visual roles support continuous dimensions. In those cases, the dimension is treated as a discrete dimension, event though it has a continuous value type.

c:property.name: timeSeriesFormat
c:property.c:documentation:
The format string used to parse dimensions of the Date value type, by default.
The syntax of the format string is that of protovis' date formats.
This property changes the default of the
property, for dimensions with a Date value type.

c:property.name: percentValueFormat
c:property.c:documentation:
A function used to format non-null numeric values as percentages.
When this property is specified,\ it sets also the format of the chart's format provider, . Consequently, its value is inherited by the number dimension types' .
Conversely, if the chart's format provider format is specified, its value sets this property, .
When both are specified, the one in the chart's format provider has precedence.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the chart.

c:complexType.name: ChartExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points common to (almost) all chart types.
Chart extension points can also be specified directly at the chart options level.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
extension property (ex: base)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: base_strokeStyle (see ).

c:property.name: rubberBand
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the selection rubber-band.

c:property.name: noDataMessage
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the "no data" label.
Use noDataMessage_text to change the message that is shown when the chart is provided with no data or empty data.

c:property.name: invalidDataMessage
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the "invalid data" label.
Data is invalid when it does not satisfy the requirements of a visualization. For example, the Pie, Sunburst and Treemap charts require that the sum of the absolute values be positive (zero excluded).
Use invalidDataMessage_text to change the message that is shown when a chart is provided with invalid data.

c:complexType.name: Plot
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of (almost) all plots.

c:property.name: name
c:property.c:documentation:
The name of the plot being defined or configured.
This option can only be used in code, from within .
To configure an internal plot, its reserved name is specified:
main the main plot of a chart; for example, a bar chart has a main plot of type bar
plot2 the special second plot; this is the plot that, in applicable chart types, is activated when the option plot2 is true; configuring the second plot this way implicitly activates it, and the value of option plot2 is ignored.
trend the special trend plot; this is the plot that, in applicable chart types, is activated when other plots specify one of the options trend or trendType.
In this case, if is also specified, it must match the plot type of the corresponding internal plot.
To define a new plot, specify a and, no name, or one that is not reserved.
The name of a plot cannot have dot (".") character in it.

c:property.name: type
c:property.c:documentation:
The type of the plot being defined or configured.
This option can only be used in code, from within .
The current list of plot types is:
barbar plot nbar100% normalized bar plot waterwaterfall plot boxbox plot heatGridheat-grid plot pointpoint plot (area/line/dot) scattermetric point plot (area/line/dot) piepie sunburstsunburst treemaptreemap bulletbullet
See for more information.

c:property.name: dataPart
c:property.c:documentation:
The data part value of the subset of data that the plot consumes.
This option can only be used in code, from within .
By default, for internal plots, like main and plot2, data is partitioned into two data parts, "0" and "1", respectively, according to the chart's plot2Series, or plot2SeriesIndexes, options (depending on the chart type, , or ).
The internal trend plot, by default, represents the data part value "trend".
For external plots, the default data part value is "0".
See for more information.

c:property.name: valuesVisible
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.
Most charts have some form of showing labels with the main value next to the visual element.
The default value really varies with the chart type, so be sure to confirm it in the most specific plot class.

c:property.name: showValues
c:property.c:documentation: Use instead. Indicates if value labels are shown next to the visual elements.

c:property.name: valuesAnchor
c:property.c:documentation:
The point of a visual element onto which the associated value label is anchored to.
The possible values and the default value actually depend on the chart type so be sure to access this property's documentation through the concrete class' documentation.

c:property.name: valuesFont
c:property.c:documentation:
The font of a value label.
This property can also be specified through the "label" extension point of a plot.
In some charts the value label font is taken into account for layout purposes.

c:property.name: valuesMask
c:property.c:documentation:
The values mask used to build the text of value labels.
The mask may contain scene variable names and/or scene atom names, like in the examples:
scene variables: {category}: {value} EUR, could yield Drinks: 3.45 EUR
atom variables: {#family} - {#product}, could yield Plains - Boeing 747
The default value depends on the plot type.

c:property.name: colorAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The index of the color axis to use for the plot.
The possible values are 1, 2 and 3.
The default value depends on the plot. The main plot of a chart always uses the axis 1. The plot2 plot uses the axis 2, by default. The trend plot uses the axis 3, by default.
